department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
course.description: Design and analysis of efficient algorithms and data structures. Algorithm design methods, graph algorithms, approximation algorithms, and randomized algorithms are covered.
course.prerequisites: Computer Science 50 or equivalent; Computer Science 51 is helpful. Some exposure to discrete applied mathematics, such as Applied Mathematics 106 or 107 or Computer Science 121 or Statistics 110, is also helpful.
course.notes: Starting in the spring of 2013, Computer Science 124 will assume background from Computer Science 20. Students will not receive credit for both CS 124 and CS 125.
